monte_carlo.cpp

1 /* University of Genoa - Software Architecture for Robotics (2017/2018) */
2 /* Project: Teleoperation with MIRO - Mateus Sanches Moura, Suman Ghosh */
3 /* Monte Carlo Simulation service source code */
4 
5 /* Libraries */
6 #include "ros/ros.h"
7 #include "miro_teleop/MonteCarlo.h"
8 #include <cstdio>
9 #include <cmath>
10 #include <map>
11 #include <boost/random.hpp>
12 #include <boost/random/normal_distribution.hpp>
13 #include <boost/random/uniform_real_distribution.hpp>
14 
15 /* Constants */
16 #define HSIZE 300 // Horizontal map size (in cm)
17 #define VSIZE 300 // Vertical map size (in cm)
18 #define RES 30 // Grid resolution
19 #define PERT_THRESH 0.5
20 #define LIMIT 10000 // Limit simulation rounds (timeout constraint)
21 
22 // Method to quantize coordinate of a point to index of discretized matrix,
23 // along a particular dimension
24 int quantize(float x, float xmin, float xmax, float quantum)
25 {
26  int n = ceil((xmax-xmin)/quantum);
27  int posOrigin = ceil(n/2.0)-1;
28  float delta = 0;
29  if (n%2 != 0) delta = quantum/2.0;
30  int index = posOrigin + ceil((x-delta)/quantum);
31  return index;
32 }
33 
34 /* Service function */
35 bool MCSimulation(miro_teleop::MonteCarlo::Request &req,
36  miro_teleop::MonteCarlo::Response &res)
37 {
38  int iters = 1000, batch = 1, max_x, max_y, count = 0;
39  float quantum = HSIZE/RES, sdx = RES, sdy = RES, rx, ry,
40  xmin=-HSIZE/2, xmax=HSIZE/2, ymin=-VSIZE/2, ymax=VSIZE/2;
41  float max_obj = 0, obj;
42 
43  // Obtain input request data
44  std_msgs::Float64 landscape[RES*RES];
45  for(int i=0;i<req.landscape.size();i++)
46  landscape[i].data = req.landscape[i].data;
47 
48  boost::mt19937 *rng = new boost::mt19937();
49 
50  rng->seed(time(NULL));
51 
52  // Uniform Distribution
53  boost::random::uniform_real_distribution<> distx(xmin, xmax);
54  boost::variate_generator< boost::mt19937,
55  boost::random::uniform_real_distribution<> > dx(*rng, distx);
56 
57  while(max_obj<PERT_THRESH)
58  {
59  for (int i = 1; i <= iters; i++)
60  {
61  rx=dx();
62  ry=dx();
63  std::cout<<"Random point generated at ("<<rx<<","<<
64  ry<<") ";
65  // Excluding points on and outside the boundary
66  if(rx>xmin && rx<xmax && ry>ymin && ry<ymax)
67  {
68  int ncols = ceil((xmax-xmin)/quantum);
69  int nrows = ceil((ymax-ymin)/quantum);
70  int index_x = quantize(rx, xmin, xmax, quantum);
71  int index_y = (nrows-1-quantize(ry, ymin, ymax,
72  quantum));
73  // Inverting to maintain mapping consistency
74  // with matrix formed by pertinence mapper
75  obj = landscape[index_y*ncols + index_x].data;
76  std::cout<<"val = "<<obj<<std::endl;
77  if(obj>1)
78  {
79  ROS_INFO("rx=%f, ry=%f, obj=%f, (%d,%d)\n",
80  rx, ry, obj, index_x, index_y);
81  }
82  if(obj>max_obj && obj<=1)
83  {
84  max_obj=obj;
85  max_x=rx;
86  max_y=ry;
87  }
88  }
89  }
90  count++;
91  if(count>=LIMIT)
92  {
93  ROS_INFO("Timeout: maximum number of rounds exceeded");
94  // Return out-of-bound numbers as a timeout flag
95  res.goal.x = 2*HSIZE;
96  res.goal.y = 2*VSIZE;
97  return true;
98  }
99  }
100 
101  res.goal.x = max_x;
102  res.goal.y = max_y;
103  ROS_INFO("Goal position: (%f,%f) with val=%f", res.goal.x, res.goal.y,
104  max_obj);
105  return true;
106 }
107 
108 /* Main function */
109 int main(int argc, char **argv)
110 {
111  /* Initialize, assign a node handler and advertise service */
112  ros::init(argc, argv, "monte_carlo_server");
113  ros::NodeHandle n;
114  ros::ServiceServer service =
115  n.advertiseService("monte_carlo", MCSimulation);
116  ROS_INFO("Monte Carlo Simulation service active");
117  ros::spin();
118 
119  return 0;
120 }
